intro: Mulgedium spicatum, commonly known as the spiked mulgedium, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender, upright stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers in late spring to early summer, which are arranged in spiciform inflorescences. Its leaves are lance-shaped, serrated, and arranged alternately along the stem. Mulgedium spicatum thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and wetlands.
